abstract: Federal appeals court in California will hear state's case for reversing decision by federal judge Cormac J Carney aimed at reforming approach to capital punishment; only 13 of 900 death row inmates have been executed since 1978, and review process can take 25 years; state officials argue these numbers reflect system's overall fairness and that court's decision violated protocol.
lead_paragraph: The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit will review a ruling last year that found the state’s capital punishment system to be dysfunctional.

headline.main: California Death Penalty, Struck Down Over Delays, Faces Next Test
headline.print_headline: Death Row Delays, Ruled Unconstitutional in California, Face Appellate Test

snippet: The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit will review a ruling last year that found the state’s capital punishment system to be dysfunctional.
